info.name: Pub/Sub System - Complete Test Suite
info.description:
Comprehensive Postman collection for testing the In-Memory Pub/Sub System.

Includes:
- All REST API endpoints
- WebSocket test examples
- Error scenarios
- Edge cases

Base URL: http://localhost:8080

item.name: 1. Health & Observability

request.description: Check system health, uptime, topic count, and subscriber count.
Get per-topic statistics including message counts and subscriber counts.

item.description: Endpoints for monitoring system health and statistics.

item.name: 2. Topic Management

request.description: Create a new topic named 'orders'. Returns 201 on success, 409 if already exists.
Create a new topic named 'notifications'.
Create a new topic named 'events'.
Create a topic for demo/testing purposes.
Try to create duplicate topic. Should return 409 Conflict.
Get list of all topics with subscriber counts.
Delete the 'demo' topic. Subscribers will receive topic_deleted notification.
Try to delete non-existent topic. Should return 404 Not Found.

item.description: REST API endpoints for creating, listing, and deleting topics.

item.name: 3. WebSocket Tests (Use WebSocket Client)

request.description:
WebSocket endpoint is at: ws://localhost:8080/ws

Postman has limited WebSocket support. For full testing, use:
1. Postman WebSocket feature (New â†’ WebSocket Request)
2. Python test scripts (test_pubsub.py or example_client.py)
3. wscat CLI tool: npm install -g wscat

See the 'WebSocket Examples' folder for message formats.

item.description: WebSocket testing information. Use the examples below in a WebSocket client.

item.name: 4. WebSocket Examples

request.description:
Connect to: ws://localhost:8080/ws

Send this JSON:
```json
{
  "type": "subscribe",
  "topic": "orders",
  "client_id": "subscriber-1"
}
```

Expected Response:
```json
{
  "type": "ack",
  "topic": "orders",
  "status": "ok",
  "ts": "2025-01-30T10:00:00Z"
}
```

Connect to: ws://localhost:8080/ws

Send this JSON:
```json
{
  "type": "subscribe",
  "topic": "orders",
  "client_id": "subscriber-2",
  "last_n": 5,
  "request_id": "req-123"
}
```

This will:
1. Subscribe to 'orders' topic
2. Receive last 5 historical messages
3. Receive future messages

Expected Response:
1. Acknowledgment
2. Up to 5 historical event messages
3. Future events as they're published

Connect to: ws://localhost:8080/ws

Send this JSON:
```json
{
  "type": "unsubscribe",
  "topic": "orders",
  "client_id": "subscriber-1",
  "request_id": "unsub-001"
}
```

Expected Response:
```json
{
  "type": "ack",
  "request_id": "unsub-001",
  "topic": "orders",
  "status": "ok",
  "ts": "2025-01-30T10:00:00Z"
}
```

After unsubscribing, the client will no longer receive events from this topic.

Connect to: ws://localhost:8080/ws

Send this JSON:
```json
{
  "type": "ping",
  "request_id": "ping-001"
}
```

Expected Response:
```json
{
  "type": "pong",
  "request_id": "ping-001",
  "ts": "2025-01-30T10:00:00Z"
}
```

Use this to check WebSocket connection health.

item.description: Example WebSocket messages. Copy these to a WebSocket client to test.

item.name: 5. WebSocket Error Scenarios

request.description:
Connect to: ws://localhost:8080/ws

Send this JSON:
```json
{
  "type": "subscribe",
  "topic": "non-existent-topic",
  "client_id": "test-client",
  "request_id": "err-001"
}
```

Expected Error Response:
```json
{
  "type": "error",
  "request_id": "err-001",
  "error": {
    "code": "TOPIC_NOT_FOUND",
    "message": "Topic 'non-existent-topic' does not exist"
  },
  "ts": "2025-01-30T10:00:00Z"
}
```

Connect to: ws://localhost:8080/ws

Send this JSON (missing client_id):
```json
{
  "type": "subscribe",
  "topic": "orders",
  "request_id": "err-002"
}
```

Expected Error Response:
```json
{
  "type": "error",
  "request_id": "err-002",
  "error": {
    "code": "BAD_REQUEST",
    "message": "client_id is required"
  },
  "ts": "2025-01-30T10:00:00Z"
}
```

Connect to: ws://localhost:8080/ws

Send this JSON (missing topic):
```json
{
  "type": "subscribe",
  "client_id": "test-client",
  "request_id": "err-003"
}
```

Expected Error Response:
```json
{
  "type": "error",
  "request_id": "err-003",
  "error": {
    "code": "BAD_REQUEST",
    "message": "topic is required"
  },
  "ts": "2025-01-30T10:00:00Z"
}
```

Connect to: ws://localhost:8080/ws

Send this JSON (missing message):
```json
{
  "type": "publish",
  "topic": "orders",
  "request_id": "err-005"
}
```

Expected Error Response:
```json
{
  "type": "error",
  "request_id": "err-005",
  "error": {
    "code": "BAD_REQUEST",
    "message": "message is required"
  },
  "ts": "2025-01-30T10:00:00Z"
}
```

item.description: Test error handling with invalid WebSocket messages.

item.name: 6. Complete Workflow Test

request.description: Verify server is running and healthy.
Create a topic for workflow testing.
Verify the topic appears in the list.
Check initial stats before any messages.
Check stats after publishing messages via WebSocket.
Clean up by deleting the test topic.
Final health check to verify system is still running.

item.description: Complete workflow testing all REST endpoints in sequence.
